This is only a standard sof setup from the year of 2000.

A sof setup has been recreated by this game-community in 2010, check the torrent here: http://thepiratebay.org/torrent/5956534

that community torrent has support websites, and the setup is optimised for multiplayer-experience.
It works on my computer

Found a fix for Windows 7 64 bit.

I honestly have no idea why this works, but it does.

1) Open the game directory that has the SoF.exe file in it.

2) Copy SoF.exe elsewhere (like your desktop).

3) Rename the SoF.exe file that's in the game's directory folder to "mohaa.exe", without the quotes.

4) Copy the SoF.exe file that's on your desktop back into the directory.

5) Run the game using the mohaa.exe file. No need for any compatibility mode settings or anything.

Apparently, this works for all Quake II engine games... except Quake II.

Enjoy!

Enjoy!
what a fuking waste of time!!! did as instructed n fukall ther tosser!!!!!!

Works a treat on Win7/64bit. Simply right click on shortcut, Properties and then Compatability, and set to run in Win98 mode with disabled desktop composition. No renaming of files needed or anything else. It worked for me, it should work for everyone else. Thanks for a great upload!

What I did to get SoF working was rename Sof.exe to mohaa.exe

Worked like a charm for me. Good luck to you
Almost forgot....before the rename, copy the sof.exe to another folder. Rename the sof.exe still in it's original location to mohaa.exe then move the copied sof.exe back. I had to do this cause the game wouldn't start without it. Run the game using mohaa.exe

this trick works for all Quake 2 engine games so far except Quake 2. I have an Nvidia but it also works on ATI cards =)
